Authors:
Digvijayini Bundhun, Shi-Ke Huang, Dhanushka Nadeeshan
Wanasinghe, Kevin D Hyde
Title:
Yuxiensis, a novel quellkörper-bearing taxon added to
Scortechiniaceae (Coronophorales)
Keywords:
Hypocreomycetidae, multi-gene, sexual morph,
Sordariomycetes, taxonomy
Abstract:
An unknown saprobic taxon collected from Yunnan Province,
China is revealed as a new genus in Scortechiniaceae. The novel taxon,
Yuxiensis is distinctly characterised by immersed to erumpent,
semi-globose ascomata which are not surrounded by any subiculum or
tomentum, a subcylindrical quellkörper in the centrum, clavate asci with
long pedicels and allantoid hyaline ascospores with granular contents.
Maximum Likelihood and Bayesian Inference phylogenetic analyses based on
LSU, TEF1 and RPB2 sequence data depict a close relationship of the new
genus to Pseudocatenomycopsis and Euacanthe, hence, confirming its
placement in Scortechiniaceae. Yuxiensis is compared with other genera
within this family using a morpho-phylogenetic approach. Morphological
illustrations, descriptions and notes are provided for the new
taxon.
